title: Ticket #7688: don't probe filetransfer plugins if not using them
description:
There is a branch: V8_9-gt7688-branch

There is a method in the FileTransfer object called InitializePlugins(). This invokes each plugin handler with the "-classad" option to see which methods are supported.

This is called explicitly in the starter when it prints its classad so that we can advertise the support methods. However, InitializePlugins() is also called inside the SimpleInit() method.

This seems helpful, but the end result is that almost every time we are instantiating FileTransfer object, we are probing all the plugins. The list of supported plugins has now growb to include box, gdrive, and likely more. Additionally, some of these plugins are written in scripted languages which needs to fire up an interpreter as well. The overhead of invoking all these plugins when every Shadow starts up is significant at scale.

Currently, the only place that actually USES the plugins is the starter. We should therefor skip the probing by default in all other places where it is not needed.

This means:

  1. Don't do it in the shadow at all
  2. Do it in the starter if plugins are actually used
  3. Do it in the starter when explicitly asked (By calling FileTransfer::GetSupportedMethods())
remarks:
2020-Jun-19 11:38:47 by jfrey:
Code Review

  • In FileTransfer::InitializeJobPlugins(), there are a couple checks for IsClient() to determine if the code is executing within the starter (the one place we need to call the plugins with -classad). These checks need to include !simple_init. condor_submit, condor_c-gahp, and condor_transfer_data are all file-transfer clients and they don't need to do this initialization. The starter is the only client that has simple_init set to false.

2020-Jun-24 10:45:44 by zmiller:
I reworked the code a bit and moved the plugin probing into Init() instead of SimpleInit(), as well as cleanly separated adding plugins to the inputfiles and adding plugins to the plugin table.

Code Review

The new changes look good.
